author: Special Correspondent
text:
‘Do not ignore urinary tract infections in children’

Sapiens Health Foundation, an NGO that provides care and support for kidney failure patients, observed World Kidney Day on Wednesday.

The theme for this year was ‘Kidney disease and children – Act early to prevent it.’ Rajan Ravichandran, founder of Sapiens, highlighted the activities of the foundation and explained to the audience the important causes of kidney disease in children and ways to prevent it.

Urinary tract infections in children, he said, should not be ignored.

They warrant detailed investigations. Lifestyle changes have also led to an increased incidence of obesity and hypertension in children, which can potentially result in kidney disease.

B.R. Nammalwar, a senior paediatric nephrologist, presided over the function. S. Vidyakar of Udhavum Karangal was the guest of honour. Actor Bindu Madhavi distributed medals to some of the children who had fought kidney diseases.

Actor ‘Crazy’ Mohan, who also participated, enlivened the atmosphere, a press release said.
title: World Kidney Day observed
